basics.name: Jason Biegel
basics.label: Urban Farmer
basics.summary: I am a detail oriented professional with a deep understanding of many technical subjects. I am currently transitioning careers from software engineering to horticulture. I have a passion for CEA which I have practiced both personally and professionally

work.summary: Organic vegetable farming on 60 acres of vegetable blocks
highlights: Lead food safety efforts for GAP certification.
Lead food safety efforts for GAP certification. Record keeping and making SOPs
Field, Greenhouse and Hydroponics
Operating skid-steer loader
Seeding and transplanting
Weeding
Harvesting
Wash and pack

work.summary: Garden City Grown is a hydroponic indoor farm supplying rare and unique herbs to cocktail bars in the NYC metro area all year round. These herbs can be used to mix and garnish artisanal cocktails. Because we service only in our local area, we are able to vastly reduce the food miles needed to deliver the herbs to customers. Faster delivery means fresher product. Fresher herbs will contribute to the flavor and aesthetic of our customerâ€™s cocktails.
highlights: Designed and operate vertical hydroponic grow systems for herbs
Incubated business at the AgTech-X co-working lab (now Agritecture)
Vastly reduced time for cleaning operations by identifying bottlenecks and streamlining them
Automated data collection from sensors in grow areas, created methods of iterative grow reviews to improve crop health
Practice food safety standards FSMA and GAP
Featured in the Innovation Station at Liberty Science Center After Dark events
Herbs and tinctures used for signature cocktails at Sustainable JC events

work.summary: I have been working as a full-time software engineer at companies of many sizes. I develop new applications and functionality that drive business-critical operations. I also support existing applications in production use.
highlights: Designed and implemented inventory management and ordering systems for eCommerce platforms
Handpicked as primary technical resource for company acquisition
Implemented features for high traffic web applications
Work with customer service department to understand user issues and fix them
Ran my own business doing freelance web development for multiple clients concurrently

volunteer.summary: Provided technical analysis of air conditions inside park greenhouses
highlights: Designed and installed aspirated boxes to house air sensors installed in production greenhouses
Generated and sent email reports on air temperature and relative humidity conditions
Collaborated on ideas for cooling greenhouses

volunteer.summary: Grow crops for people in my community.
highlights: Identify and remove pests and diseases in crops
Designed off-grid solar power electrical system
Setup small greenhouse for seed germination
Teach composting to people in the community

volunteer.summary: Developed a standardized grow recipe data format for controlled environment agriculture.
highlights: Gave presentations on concepts for standardizing grow recipes
Work with an international team of stake-holders to gather requirements

volunteer.summary: Held positions as president and treasurer of a non-profit makerspace. We had a wood shop, CNC router, 3D printer which I utilize for various projects.
highlights: Taught several classes on tech and urban farming
Hosted and participated in events at the space.
